intro: Xylosma armata, commonly known as the armed xylosma, is a shrub native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Tiliaceae and is characterized by its dense, often spiny foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. Its bark is thick and corky, providing structural support and protection against herbivores. Xylosma armata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
